DOC.brief_summary: The main hypothesis study increase Body Mass Index ( BMI ) alter oral contraceptive metabolism manner result decrease effectiveness obese woman .
DOC.detailed_description: This study conduct understand effective oral hormonal birth control ( pill ) woman high body mass index ( `` BMI '' - ratio height weight BMI '' ) . Previous study birth control traditionally include woman certain BMI number , safety efficacy clearly understood population , yet pill still widely use woman high BMI . Reproductive-aged , ovulatory woman obese ( BMI > 30 kg/m2 ) , place oral contraceptive 2 month , randomize two intervention arm additional 2 month . At several key time point , synthetic steroid pharmacokinetics , gonadotropin ( LH , FSH ) ovarian hormone level ( estradiol , progesterone ) , ovarian follicular activity ultrasound monitoring , cervical mucus test monitor .
DOC.criteria: Age 1835 BMI > 30kg/m2 Proof normal breast pelvic exam within last 9 month Self report normal menstrual period ( 2435 day ) Good general health In investigator 's opinion , subject 's vein suitable repeat blood draw dictate study protocol Single progesterone level screen visit ≥ 3ng/mL Hematocrit ≥ 36 % Contradictions COCs ( history deep vein thrombosis , myocardial infection , uncontrolled hypertension , pulmonary embolus , diabetes vascular change , stroke , migraines neurologic change , breast cancer , impair liver function , uncontrolled thyroid disease , hypersensitivity allergy birth control ) Smoker ( must smoke 0 cigarette ) Actively seeking/involved weight loss program Currently pregnant/seeking pregnancy next 6 month Currently breastfeed Past current diagnosis polycystic ovarian disease Recent use birth control ( Depot medroxyprogesterone : 6 month , Progestin implant : 6 month , Oral contraceptive , patch ring : 2 month , Hormone impregnate IUD : 6 month ) Currently take medication interfere COC 's ( Rifampin , Carbamazepine , St. John 's Wort )
